and make another sleeve yoke when working this section you may find it difficult for the first couple row to work across the sleeve sts since the underarm bobble is very small we have found that if you prefer to try using the dpns for each section instead of the circular with all rs facing and larger circular needle k21 24 27 sts k2tog k1 from right front pm k1 ssk k36 38 40 sts k2tog k1 from one sleeve pm k1 ssk k49 52 57 sts k2tog k1 from back pm k1 ssk k36 38 40 sts k2tog k1 from one sleeve pm k1 ssk k21 24 27 sts from left front 8 sts decrease d 179 192 207 sts read through entire section before proceeding you will be shaping the front neck as well as the raglan seams at the same time row 2 ws p all sts decrease row rs *k to 3 sts before m k2tog k1 sl m ssk repeat from * 3 times more k to end of row 8 sts decrease d 171 184 199 sts cont to work the decrease every rs row 16 17 18 times more while working every other ws row in k to create a ridge 128 136 144 sts decrease d at the same time decrease 1 st at each neck edge on next and following 4th row 4 5 6 times 35 38 43 sts remain when all shaping is complete- 2 3 4 sts for each front 19 20 23 sts for the back 6 6 6 sts for each sleeve place sts onto a holder front band with rs facing and smaller circular needle pick up and k35 35 40 sts along the right front to neck shaping pick up and k 25 28 30 sts along the neck shaping to sts on holder k39 38 43 sts from holder increase 4 3 4 sts evenly across pick up and k25 28 30 sts along the left neck shaping pick up and k35 35 40 sts along the left front to co edge 163 167 187 sts working in garter st work 6 row buttonhole row for a boy ws *k5 5 6 sts yo k2tog repeat from * 4 times more k to end of row buttonhole row for a girl ws k to last 35 35 40 sts *yo k2tog k5 5 6 sts repeat from * 4 times more k6 more row and then bobble all sts in k sew 5 buttons onto the front sew the underarm seam weave in all ends ©2014 plymouth yarn
